mercury.name: Mercury
mercury.description: Terrestrial planet. First planet from the Sun. Mercury's core has higher iron content than any other planet in the Solar System.

venus.name: Venus
venus.description: Terrestrial planet. Second planet from the Sun. Closest in mass and size to Earth. Densest atmosphere of the terrestrial planets.

mars.name: Mars
mars.description: Terrestrial planet. Possibility of life. Surface consists of minerals containing silicon and oxygen, metals, and other elements that typically make up rock.

jupiter.name: Jupiter
jupiter.description: Gas giant. Largest planet in the Solar System. First planet to form.

saturn.name: Saturn
saturn.description: Gas giant. Second largest planet in the Solar System. Bright and extensive ring system. Saturn has a pale yellow hue due to ammonia crystals in its upper atmosphere.

uranus.name: Uranus
uranus.description: Gaseous ice giant. Made up of water, ammonia, and methane. Uranus has a ring system, a magnetosphere, and many natural satellites.

neptune.name: Neptune
neptune.description: Furthest known planet from the sun. Densest giant planet. Primarily composed of gases and liquids. Neptune's atmosphere has active and consistently visible weather patterns.

moon.name: Moon
moon.description: Earth's only natural satellite. Covered in lunar dust and marked by mountains, impact craters, their ejecta, ray-like streaks.

europa.name: Europa
europa.description: Smoothest surface of any known solid object in the Solar System. Water ocean beneath the surface, which could conceivably harbor extraterrestrial life.

titan.name: Titan
titan.description: Only moon known to have an atmosphere denser than the Earth's. Clear evidence of stable bodies of surface liquid has been found. Most Earth-like celestial body in the Solar System.

deimos.name: Deimos
deimos.description: Smaller and outer of the two natural satellites of Mars. Composed of rock rich in carbonaceous material.

charon.name: Charon
charon.description: Largest of the five known natural satellites of the dwarf planet Pluto. 12th-largest natural satellite in the Solar System. Composition of 55% rock to 45% ice.

proxima-centauri.name: Proxima Centauri
proxima-centauri.description: Small, low mass star located in the southern constellation of Centaurus. It orbits with a period of about 550,000 years. The internal mixing of its fuel by convection through its core, and Proxima's relatively low energy-production rate, mean that it will be a main-sequence star for another four trillion years.

barnards-star.name: Barnard's Star
barnards-star.description: Among the most studied red dwarfs. Current work suggests no planets orbit this star.

luhman-16.name: Luhman 16
luhman-16.description: Binary brown-dwarf system in the southern constellation Vela. The orbital period of its components is approximately 25 years
